name: Vegan Chocolate Chip Muffins with Coconut
description: Vegan Chocolate Chip Muffins with coconut. These Soft, moist and chocolatey muffins take just a few minutes and have no added oil. Vegan Nut-free Soy-free Recipe. Use dried fruit instead of chocolate to make oilMakes 10 to 12 muffins
recipeIngredient: 1 cup non dairy milk such as almond or coconut
1/2 cup maple syrup ((add 1 tbsp sugar for sweeter))
1/2 tsp cinnamon or other spices (, optional)
1/2 tsp vinegar ((apple cider vinegar or white))
1 1/4 cup flour ((I use half whole wheat pastry/spelt and half all purpose))
2/3 cup vegan chocolate chips  (and 2 tbsp for topping)

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F. Line a muffin tin with liners. In a blender, combine all the wet ingredients and blend for a minute to break down most of the coconut.
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F. Line a muffin tin with liners. In a blender, combine all the wet ingredients and blend for a minute to break down most of the coconut.

recipeInstructions.text: In a bowl mix all the dry ingredients well. Add the blended wet mixture. Mix to just about combine. (Add 1 tbsp oil if you plan to store these for longer).
recipeInstructions.name: In a bowl mix all the dry ingredients well. Add the blended wet mixture. Mix to just about combine. (Add 1 tbsp oil if you plan to store these for longer).

recipeInstructions.text: Fold in the chocolate chips. Spoon the batter into muffin pan.
recipeInstructions.name: Fold in the chocolate chips. Spoon the batter into muffin pan.

recipeInstructions.text: Bake at 375 degrees F for 20 to 25 mins. To make a loaf, bake for 45 minutes or until a toothpick from the center comes out clean.
recipeInstructions.name: Bake at 375 degrees F for 20 to 25 mins. To make a loaf, bake for 45 minutes or until a toothpick from the center comes out clean.
